verses.verse: After <S%G3326><s%> these things <S%G5023><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> departed <S%G5563><s%> from <S%G1537><s%> Athens, <S%G116><s%> and came <S%G2064><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Corinth. <S%G2882><s%>

He <S%G2532><s%> found <S%G2147><s%> a certain <S%G5100><s%> Jew <S%G2453><s%> named <S%G3686><s%> Aquila, <S%G207><s%> a man of Pontus <S%G4193><s%> by race, <S%G1085><s%> who had recently <S%G4373><s%> come <S%G2064><s%> from <S%G575><s%> Italy, <S%G2482><s%> with <S%G2532><s%> his <S%G846><s%> wife <S%G1135><s%> Priscilla, <S%G4252><s%> because <S%G1223><s%> Claudius <S%G2804><s%> had commanded <S%G1299><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%> to depart <S%G5563><s%> from <S%G1537><s%> Rome. <S%G4516><s%> He came <S%G4334><s%> to them, <S%G846><s%>

and <S%G2532><s%> because <S%G1223><s%> he practiced <S%G1511><s%> the same trade, <S%G3673><s%> he lived <S%G3306><s%> with <S%G3844><s%> them <S%G846><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> worked, <S%G2038><s%> for <S%G1063><s%> by trade <S%G5078><s%> they were tent makers. <S%G4635><s%>

He <S%G1161><s%> reasoned <S%G1256><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the synagogue <S%G4864><s%> <S%G2596><s%> every <S%G3956><s%> Sabbath, <S%G4521><s%> and <S%G5037><s%> persuaded <S%G3982><s%> Jews <S%G2453><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> Greeks. <S%G1672><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> when <S%G5613><s%> <S%G99999><s%> Silas <S%G4609><s%> and <S%G1161><s%> Timothy <S%G5095><s%> came <S%G2718><s%> down from <S%G575><s%> Macedonia, <S%G3109><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> was compelled <S%G4912><s%> by the Spirit, <S%G4151><s%> testifying <S%G1263><s%> to the Jews <S%G2453><s%> that Jesus <S%G2424><s%> was the Christ. <S%G5547><s%>

When <S%G1161><s%> they opposed <S%G498><s%> him <S%G846><s%> and <S%G1161><s%> blasphemed, <S%G987><s%> he shook <S%G1621><s%> out his clothing <S%G2440><s%> and said <S%G2036><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> them, <S%G846><s%> "Your <S%G5216><s%> blood <S%G129><s%> be on <S%G1909><s%> your own <S%G5216><s%> heads! <S%G2776><s%> I <S%G1473><s%> am clean. <S%G2513><s%> From <S%G575><s%> now on, <S%G3568><s%> I will go <S%G4198><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> the Gentiles! <S%G1484><s%>"

He <S%G2532><s%> departed <S%G3327><s%> there, <S%G1564><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> went into <S%G1519><s%> the house <S%G3614><s%> of a certain <S%G5100><s%> man named <S%G3686><s%> Justus, <S%G2459><s%> one who <S%G3739><s%> worshiped <S%G4576><s%> God, <S%G2316><s%> whose <S%G3588><s%> house <S%G3614><s%> was <S%G2258><s%> next door <S%G4927><s%> to the synagogue. <S%G4864><s%>

<S%G1161><s%> Crispus, <S%G2921><s%> the ruler of the synagogue, <S%G752><s%> believed <S%G4100><s%> in the Lord <S%G2962><s%> with <S%G4862><s%> all <S%G3650><s%> his <S%G846><s%> house. <S%G3624><s%> <S%G2532><s%> Many <S%G4183><s%> of the Corinthians, <S%G2881><s%> when they heard, <S%G191><s%> believed <S%G4100><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> were baptized. <S%G907><s%>

The <S%G2036><s%> Lord <S%G2962><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> to Paul <S%G3972><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the night <S%G3571><s%> by <S%G1223><s%> a vision, <S%G3705><s%> "Don't <S%G3361><s%> be <S%G5399><s%> afraid, <S%G5399><s%> but <S%G235><s%> speak <S%G2980><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> don't <S%G3361><s%> be <S%G4623><s%> silent; <S%G4623><s%>

He <S%G5037><s%> lived <S%G2523><s%> there a year <S%G1763><s%> and <S%G5037><s%> six <S%G1803><s%> months, <S%G3376><s%> teaching <S%G1321><s%> the word <S%G3056><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> them. <S%G846><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> when Gallio <S%G1058><s%> was proconsul <S%G445><s%> of Achaia, <S%G882><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%> with one accord <S%G3661><s%> rose <S%G2721><s%> up against Paul <S%G3972><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> brought <S%G71><s%> him <S%G846><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> the judgment seat, <S%G968><s%>
saying, <S%G3754><s%> "This <S%G3778><s%> man persuades <S%G374><s%> men <S%G444><s%> to worship <S%G4576><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> contrary to <S%G3844><s%> the law. <S%G3551><s%>"

But <S%G1161><s%> when Paul <S%G3972><s%> was about <S%G3195><s%> to open <S%G455><s%> his mouth, <S%G4750><s%> Gallio <S%G1058><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> the Jews, <S%G2453><s%> "If <S%G3303><s%> indeed it were <S%G2258><s%> a <S%G3767><s%> matter <S%G5100><s%> of <S%G5599><s%> wrong <S%G92><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> of <S%G5599><s%> wicked <S%G4190><s%> crime, <S%G2453><s%> you Jews, it would be reasonable <S%G3056><s%> that <S%G2596><s%> I <S%G302><s%> should bear <S%G430><s%> with you; <S%G5216><s%>

but <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> they are <S%G2076><s%> questions <S%G2213><s%> about <S%G4012><s%> words <S%G3056><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> names <S%G3686><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> <S%G2596><s%> your <S%G5209><s%> own law, <S%G3551><s%> look <S%G3700><s%> to it yourselves. <S%G846><s%> For <S%G1063><s%> I <S%G1473><s%> don't <S%G3756><s%> want <S%G1014><s%> to be <S%G1511><s%> a judge <S%G2923><s%> of these matters. <S%G5130><s%>"
He <S%G2532><s%> drove <S%G556><s%> them <S%G846><s%> from <S%G575><s%> the judgment seat. <S%G968><s%>

Then <S%G1161><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> the Greeks <S%G1672><s%> laid hold <S%G1949><s%> on Sosthenes, <S%G4988><s%> the ruler of the synagogue, <S%G752><s%> and beat <S%G5180><s%> him before <S%G1715><s%> the judgment seat. <S%G968><s%> <S%G2532><s%> Gallio <S%G1058><s%> didn't <S%G3199><s%> care about any <S%G3762><s%> of these things. <S%G5130><s%>

<S%G1161><s%> Paul, <S%G3972><s%> having stayed <S%G4357><s%> after this many <S%G2425><s%> more days, <S%G2250><s%> took his leave <S%G657><s%> of the brothers, <S%G80><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> sailed from there <S%G1602><s%> for <S%G1519><s%> Syria, <S%G4947><s%> together <S%G2532><s%> with <S%G4862><s%> <S%G846><s%> Priscilla <S%G4252><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> Aquila. <S%G207><s%> He shaved <S%G2751><s%> his head <S%G2776><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> Cenchreae, <S%G2747><s%> for <S%G1063><s%> he had <S%G2192><s%> a vow. <S%G2171><s%>

He <S%G1161><s%> came <S%G2658><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Ephesus, <S%G2181><s%> and <S%G1161><s%> he left them <S%G2641><s%> there; <S%G847><s%> but <S%G1161><s%> he <S%G1525><s%> himself <S%G846><s%> entered <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the synagogue, <S%G4864><s%> and reasoned <S%G1256><s%> with the Jews. <S%G2453><s%>

When <S%G1161><s%> they <S%G846><s%> asked <S%G2065><s%> him to <S%G1909><s%> stay <S%G3306><s%> with <S%G3844><s%> them <S%G846><s%> a longer <S%G4119><s%> time, <S%G5550><s%> he <S%G1962><s%> declined; <S%G3756><s%>

but <S%G235><s%> taking <S%G657><s%> his leave <S%G657><s%> of them, <S%G846><s%> and saying, <S%G2036><s%> "I <S%G3165><s%> must <S%G1163><s%> by all means <S%G3843><s%> keep <S%G4160><s%> this coming <S%G2064><s%> feast <S%G1859><s%> in <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem, <S%G2414><s%> but <S%G1161><s%> I will return <S%G344><s%> again <S%G3825><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> you <S%G5209><s%> if <S%G2309><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> wills, <S%G2309><s%>" he <S%G2532><s%> set sail <S%G321><s%> from <S%G575><s%> Ephesus. <S%G2181><s%>

When <S%G2532><s%> he had landed <S%G2718><s%> at <S%G1519><s%> Caesarea, <S%G2542><s%> he went up <S%G305><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> greeted <S%G782><s%> the assembly, <S%G1577><s%> and went down <S%G2597><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Antioch. <S%G490><s%>

Having <S%G2532><s%> spent <S%G4160><s%> some <S%G5100><s%> time <S%G5550><s%> there, <S%G1831><s%> he departed, and went through <S%G1330><s%> the region <S%G5561><s%> of Galatia, <S%G1054><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> Phrygia, <S%G5435><s%> in order, <S%G2517><s%> establishing <S%G1991><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> the disciples. <S%G3101><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> a certain <S%G5100><s%> Jew <S%G2453><s%> named <S%G3686><s%> Apollos, <S%G625><s%> an Alexandrian <S%G221><s%> by race, <S%G1085><s%> an eloquent <S%G3052><s%> man, <S%G435><s%> came <S%G2658><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Ephesus. <S%G2181><s%> He <S%G5607><s%> was mighty <S%G1415><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the Scriptures. <S%G1124><s%>

This man <S%G3778><s%> had been <S%G2258><s%> instructed <S%G2727><s%> in the way <S%G3598><s%> of the Lord; <S%G2962><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> being fervent <S%G2204><s%> in spirit, <S%G4151><s%> he spoke <S%G2980><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> taught <S%G1321><s%> accurately <S%G199><s%> the things <S%G3588><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> Jesus, <S%G2962><s%> although he knew <S%G1987><s%> only <S%G3440><s%> the baptism <S%G908><s%> of John. <S%G2491><s%>

<S%G5037><s%> He <S%G3778><s%> began <S%G756><s%> to speak boldly <S%G3955><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the synagogue. <S%G1161><s%> But when <S%G191><s%> Priscilla <S%G4252><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> Aquila <S%G207><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> him, <S%G846><s%> they took <S%G4355><s%> him <S%G846><s%> aside, <S%G4355><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> explained <S%G1620><s%> to him <S%G846><s%> the way <S%G3598><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> more accurately. <S%G199><s%>

When he <S%G846><s%> had determined <S%G1014><s%> to pass <S%G1330><s%> over into <S%G1519><s%> Achaia, <S%G882><s%> the brothers <S%G80><s%> encouraged <S%G4389><s%> him, <S%G846><s%> and wrote <S%G1125><s%> to the disciples <S%G3101><s%> to receive <S%G588><s%> him. <S%G846><s%> When <S%G3739><s%> he had come, <S%G3854><s%> he greatly <S%G4183><s%> helped those <S%G4820><s%> who <S%G3588><s%> had believed <S%G4100><s%> through <S%G1223><s%> grace; <S%G5485><s%>

for <S%G1063><s%> he powerfully <S%G2159><s%> refuted <S%G1246><s%> the Jews, <S%G2453><s%> publicly <S%G1219><s%> showing <S%G1925><s%> by <S%G1223><s%> the Scriptures <S%G1124><s%> that <S%G1925><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> was <S%G1511><s%> the Christ. <S%G5547><s%>
